question:
Woman: You met John at the last meeting. .......... you?
Man: I don't think so.

Man: Is that your sister's car?
Woman: Actually, it's ..........
Man: Lucky you!

Woman: always travel by bus.
Man: Why?
Woman: Because it's …….. than the train.

Man: Are you going to the movies tonight?
Woman: I might go this Friday ........ about you?

Man: Where's Billy?
Woman: He's ……… his bedroom, I think.

Man: Did you find any documentation about the new office printer?
Woman: No. I looked on the manufacturer's website but ……… there.

Woman: I think my computer is broken. It won't ..... up.
Man: Sorry, I can't help much. I don't know ……. Computers!

Woman: I'll be back in the office on Monday.
Man: Okay ………. a good weekend!

Woman: Sorry I didn't come to your party.
Man: What happened?
Woman: Oh. I ……… sick, so I went to sleep.

Waiter: May I take your order?
Customer: Do you have soup today?
Waiter: Let me check. I'll be right back. What does the waiter mean by her SECOND comment?
options: A. Please wait. I will find out.
B. I'm sorry. There's no soup on the menu.
C. Please come with me. You can pay now.
answer: A. Please wait. I will find out.

question:
Man: I am hungry. I did not eat lunch.
Woman: Okay, let's go.

Man: I'm so thirsty.
Woman: Here …… some water.

Woman: Do you want another coffee?
Man: No thanks, I've had ………..

……….. Man: Can I speak to Mr. Brown, please?
Woman: He is here

Woman: The park is really busy today. Is it a holiday?
Man: I don't think so. Let's find a quieter place.
What does the woman mean?
options: A. The park is closed today.
B. There are many people in the park.
C. She wants to go to a different park.
answer: B. There are many people in the park.

question:
Man: Where is my book?
Woman: Here it is
What does the man mean?

Man: I've lost my keys!
Woman: Did you have them at work?
What does the man mean?
options: A. He can't find his keys.
B. He left his keys at work.
answer: A. He can't find his keys.

question:
Woman: We can take the bus on Smith Street.
Man: No, we can't. We'll be late.
Woman: Okay, let's take a taxi.
What does the man mean?
options: A. The bus will be too slow.
B. The taxi is waiting on Smith Street.
C. He wants to walk to the bus station.
answer: A. The bus will be too slow.

question:
Man: Good morning. I'd like to get a ticket to New York.
Woman: Of course. When would you like to fly?
What does the woman mean?
options: A. What time do you want to leave?
B. How long will you be on the airplane?
C. When are you coming back from New York?
answer: A. What time do you want to leave?

question:
Woman: What are your plans for the weekend?
Man: I ………….. to the park with friends.

Girl: Good news. My mother let me ………. at school until five today.
Boy: That's good. We can study for the exam.

Woman: Are you still writing letters by hand? I can’t believe it. You need to get with the times!
Man: What do you mean?
Woman: I got you this computer last year and you’ve hardly touched it.
What does the woman mean by her FIRST statement?
options: A. She wants to help the man fix his computer.
B. She believes the man needs to buy a new computer.
C. She thinks the man needs to use the computer more.
answer: C. She thinks the man needs to use the computer more.

question:
Woman: Did you like the food at the restaurant this time?

Woman: Where do you live?
Man: In Boston ……………. There for six years now.

Girl: What are you doing this weekend?
Boy: I……….. to the movies with my brother.

Waiter: May I take your order?
Customer: Do you have soup today?
Waiter: Let me check. I’ll be right back.
What does the waiter mean by her SECOND comment?
options: A. Please wait. I will find out.
B. I’m sorry. There’s no soup on the menu.
C. Please come with me. You can pay now.
answer: A. Please wait. I will find out.

question:
Woman: How is your mother doing?
Man: She’s feeling much better. Thanks.
What does the man mean?
options: A. His mother isn’t sick anymore.
B. He doesn’t see his mother very often.
C. His mother still doesn’t feel very well.
answer: A. His mother isn’t sick anymore.

question:
Woman: Where did you ……….. last night?
Man: Nowhere. I stayed home and watched television.

Woman: Can I borrow a pen?
Man: Sorry I ………. Have one.

Man: Good morning. I’d like to get a ticket to New York.
Woman: Of course. Where would you like to fly?
What does the woman mean?
options: A. What time do you want to leave?
B. How long will you be on the airplane?

answer: A. What time do you want to leave?

question:
Man: I am hungry. I …………. not eat lunch.
Woman: Okay, let’s go get something to eat.

Woman: How often do you ride the bus to work?
Man: I ………… ride the bus. I walk every day.
